Title:
Molecular study of Dermatocarpon miniatum (Verrucariales) and
allied taxa.
Abstract:
The phylogeny of the Dermatocarpon miniatum-complex
(Verrucariales, lichenized Ascomycotina) was studied using ITS and 5.8S
data. The ITS area was shown to contain a substantial amount of
variation which resolves the relationships of terminal groups, while the
more basal clades have low support in the analyses. D. miniatum var.
miniatum and D. miniatum var. complicatum are polyphyletic while D.
miniatum var. cirsodes is monophyletic but located within the complex as
are both D. leptophyllum and D. linkolae. While the D. miniatum-complex
varies in the ITS sequences, some transatlantic species such as D.
luridum and D. meiophyllizum only differ in a few base pairs.
Dermatocarpon taminium sp. nov. from the Greater Sonoran area is
described and D. tenue comb. nov. is proposed.
